title: Ticket #5060: Add "foreach" capability to DAGMan
description:
A possibility that was discussed during HTCondor Week is adding something like the new condor_submit "foreach" capability to DAGMan. (One note on condor_submit "foreach": I don't know if we want to encourage people to heavily use that within DAGMan, because if you have submit files that generate a lot of jobs, you really decrease the value of rescue DAGs.)

Anyhow, I think that something like this is a good idea, but the big question is whether this should be incorporated directly into DAGMan, or whether it should be part of a DAG-generation tool (see #2646).
remarks:
2015-May-22 09:46:23 by wenger:
Hmm -- if we do this inside DAGMan, an interesting question is when the expansion should take place -- at DAG parse time, or when you actually get to that part of the DAG? If you're doing the file globbing form, that could make a big difference, if the stuff you're globbing was produced by an earlier part of the DAG.

I suspect that it would be quite a bit easier to do the expansion at parse time, but doing it when you get to the relevant part of the DAG could be useful (although you could get a lot of the benefit of the latter with sub-DAGs).
